subject: Re: [junit] Reloading tests with text runner?
msgSnippet: ... From: Ives Aerts  ... I just uploaded an example to the files section using my own classloader. You could use the junit reloading
messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: "Ives Aerts" <ives+junit@...>
> We are using JUnit on an embedded platform where:
> + restarting the VM is expensive
> + we can only use the junit.textui.TestRunner
> + we can update jar files on the platform and restart tests by
> attaching to the (running VM) and calling TestRunner.run()
>
> Is it possible to make the textui TestRunner use a new classloader for
> each invocation so that tests and tested classes are reloaded from the
> updated jar files?
>

I just uploaded an example to the files section using my own classloader.
You could use the junit reloading classloader as well.

- Neil Swingler
